alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 18 at 1:46PM CDT until July 18 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND THE THREAT FOR DRY THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE EASTERN NEBRASKA PANHANDLE...WESTERN SANDHILLS AND PORTIONS OF FAR SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... * Affected Area...In NEZ210...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * Winds...South 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 14 percent. * Temperatures...97 to 106. * Lightning...Isolated thunderstorms capable of dry lightning may develop. * Impacts...Any fire starts will be difficult or impossible to contain.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
